column2:
Nursing Triage Note
Baby boy [**Known lastname 473**] brought to NICU for sepsis eval d/t maternal risk factors as noted in MD note above.
Infant pink and crying on admission.  Placed on servo warmer, vitals as noted on flow sheet.  Infant very active and alert, sucking on pacifier and fingers.  CBC and blood cultures obtained.  New born meds given and documented.  Tags checked.  D-stick 65.  Void, no stool.  Infant examined by MD.  Plan to transfer to NBN, given report to RN for further care.
column3:
Atrial fibrillation. Low limb lead QRS voltage. Indeterminate axis. Modest
non-specific intraventricular conduction delay. Probable infero-posterior
myocardial infarction, age indeterminate. Diffuse ST-T wave abnormalities are
non-specific but cannot exclude ischemia. Clinical correlation is suggested.
Since the previous tracing of [**2180-11-5**] no significant change.
column4:
Family Information
   Next of [**Doctor First Name **]:
   Health Care Proxy appointed:
   Family Spokesperson designated:
   Communication or visitation restriction:
   Patient Information:
   Previous living situation: Home alone
   Previous level of functioning: Independent
   Previous [**Hospital1 54**] or other hospital admissions: Yes
   Past psychiatric history: Pt has seen a number of social workers, she
   states, but did not state why.
   Past addictions history: A HX of EtOH use
   Employment status: Retired
   Legal involvement: None known
   Mandated Reporting Information:
   Additional Information:
   Patient / Family Assessment: Met briefly with pt who said that she was
   tired and did not want to talk. When told that this worker wanted to
   see how she was doing re her medical problems, viz., her breast CA, at
   which point she did start talking about her concerns. She feared that
   they would find that she has CA in both breasts. Ms. [**Known lastname **] said that
   she would not allow them to use dye related to doing a biopsy, because
   she "would die." It appears that previously she had a major allergic
   reaction. She is followed by a SW in [**Company 319**]. The pt could only remember
   that her first name, [**Doctor First Name 20**]. When asked if she wanted this writer to
   contact the SW to let her know of her hospitalization, she said no,
   that she would call tomorrow. When asked if there were people to whom
   she could turn to for support, she said yes, but did not say anymore
   other than the fact that she likes people. Some of the pt's
   reservations about talking may have been because she thought this
   worker would be asking about her EtOH use; because she was not queried
   may explain why she talked as much as she did. When talking about her
   breast CA, pt's eyes became teary, but because of the tenuousness of
   this brief contact, it felt premature to talk about her affect.
   Communication with Team:
   Primary Nurse: [**First Name8 (NamePattern2) 206**] [**Last Name (NamePattern1) 3008**]
   Plan / Follow up:
   1. To notify floor SW, who has previously seen pt, regarding her
   possible current psychosocial state.

column6:
Resp care note
Pt self extubated today. ABG's showed worsening acidosis, aceptable oxygenation. Electively re-intubated pt.  ABG's improving with mechanical ventilation. See flowsheet for vent settings.  Sx mod thick tan secretions.
column7:
83YO M w/ PMH of metastatic melanoma to lungs and now brain (2wk ago)
   who presented this evening w/ hallucinations and altered MS today. The
   patient has recently been neutropenic, in an OSH for 5 days 2 wk ago,
   found to have brain mets w/ some swelling. Also, exposure to flu A
   positive grand daughter last week - thought to be likely "swine flu" as
   per family. Has cough, but chronic but no new symptoms concerning for
   flu although did spend a great deal of time w/ granddaughter
   Around 1AM, the pt ambulated to the bathroom without supplemental
   oxygen. He noted significant  SOB  with returning to bed and was found
   to have desaturated to as low as the mid 60s. With NRB, ABG was 7.23,
   87, 78, 38.  transferred to the [**Hospital Unit Name 4**] for ongoing monitoring and care
   Significant Events:
   A/B Flu antigen tests both negative, flu precautions discontinued.
   Chest CTA for pna vs [**Doctor Last Name 6131**] done, results pending.
   Antibiotic coverage narrowed, for ? PNA
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 76**])
   Assessment:
   Rec
d pt on NIV, BiPap 16/8 with 02 sat 94-98% ABG this am 7.30/69/84.
   pt more awake as the morning progressed. Flu a/b direct antigen
   returned negative.
   Action:
   BiPap removed, pt placed on 02 2L n/c, albuterol/ atrovent nebs given
   a/o. Chest CT done to determine if consolidation seen on CXR is PNA or
   effusion. Ampicillin, Acyclovir and Cefepime discontinued, Zosyn added.
   Off Flu precautions
   Response:
   Pt tol well, 02 sat 92-96% though pt does desat briefly into the mid
   80%
s when asleep repeat ABG tis pm 7.30/67/97
   Plan:
   Cont IV abx a/o 02 n/c during the day  BiPap at night for ? OSA
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   Pt a/o x3 Follows commands consistently after initial dose of decadron
   for vascular edema around brain leision seen on head CT. and removal of
   BiPap.
   Action:
   Decadron 4mg IV q6hrs continued, 02 via n/c as above
   Response:
   Pt tol well fsbs in the 200
s with steroids.
   Plan:
   Cont steroids a/o, BiPap at night for ?OSA

column9:
NPN:

Neuro: Alert and oriented X3, MAE with equal strength and conversing appropriately. C/o feeling tired..dozing intermittently.
CV: 70's SR with rare APC. pr.20 Palp pedal pulses. Able to wean off neo after 1u PRBC's given for hct 26.8..Post hct 27.7. K and Ca WNL. Mg repleted.
Resp: Lungs very diminished in bases. Sats 91-93% with ^ 4-6L nc. Lasix given.  Alb nebs given. Pt using IS to 500cc, Cough fair-?prod sm amt clear. ABG's adequate. CXR taken. CT's with min dng-dc'd @ 14pm.
GU: Foley to gd with uo> 35cc/hr. Initially with good response to 6am IV lasix, repeated @ 13pm with marginal response-Lasix 40mg given at 15pm. Cr 1.3.
GI: Abd obese soft, NT, ND .+belching, reglan given X1, Tol sm amts food and good liquids.
Endo: Glucoses 155-248..covered per CTS post gtt SS with 6-12 u reg sc insulin. Pt not restarted on oral agents r/t Decreased po intake.
Incisions: Sternum DSD-D/I, CT with elastoplast dressing post removal.
Activity: OOB to chair with 2 assists-tol well-up for 4hrs.
Comfort: Percocet and toradol given for pain with good relief. Pt with C/o min pain.
A: Weaned off neo, requiring ^ O2 to maintain sats>92.
P: Pulmonary toilet, Lasix as tol, Back OOB in PM, Cardiac rehab.
column10:
PATIENT/TEST INFORMATION:
Indication: Left ventricular function. Right ventricular function. Mechanical AOV
Height: (in) 70
Weight (lb): 150
BSA (m2): 1.85 m2
BP (mm Hg): 118/30
HR (bpm): 115
Status: Inpatient
Date/Time: [**2165-6-22**] at 16:47
Test: Portable TTE (Complete)
Doppler: Full Doppler and color Doppler
Contrast: None
Technical Quality: Adequate


INTERPRETATION:

Findings:

This study was compared to the prior study of [**2165-2-28**].


LEFT ATRIUM: Moderate LA enlargement.

RIGHT ATRIUM/INTERATRIAL SEPTUM: Moderately dilated RA.

LEFT VENTRICLE: Mild symmetric LVH with normal cavity size. Mild global LV
hypokinesis. No resting LVOT gradient.

RIGHT VENTRICLE: Mildly dilated RV cavity. Mild global RV free wall
hypokinesis. Paradoxic septal motion consistent with prior cardiac surgery.

AORTA: Normal aortic diameter at the sinus level. Normal ascending aorta
diameter.

AORTIC VALVE: Bileaflet aortic valve prosthesis (AVR). AVR well seated, normal
leaflet/disc motion and transvalvular gradients. Trace AR. [The amount of AR
is normal for this AVR.]

MITRAL VALVE: Mildly thickened mitral valve leaflets. Mild (1+) MR.

TRICUSPID VALVE: Mild [1+] TR. Normal PA systolic pressure.

PULMONIC VALVE/PULMONARY ARTERY: Normal pulmonic valve leaflet. No PS.
Physiologic PR.

PERICARDIUM: No pericardial effusion.

GENERAL COMMENTS: Resting tachycardia (HR>100bpm).

Conclusions:
The left atrium is moderately dilated. The right atrium is moderately dilated.
There is mild symmetric left ventricular hypertrophy with normal cavity size.
There is mild global left ventricular hypokinesis (LVEF = 40-45%), with
slightly more prominent septal hypokinesis in the setting of tachycardia. The
right ventricular cavity is mildly dilated with mild global free wall
hypokinesis. A bileaflet aortic valve prosthesis is present. The aortic valve
prosthesis appears well seated, with normal leaflet/disc motion and
transvalvular gradients. Trace aortic regurgitation is seen. [The amount of
regurgitation present is normal for this prosthetic aortic valve.] The mitral
valve leaflets are mildly thickened. Mild (1+) mitral regurgitation is seen.
The estimated pulmonary artery systolic pressure is normal. There is no
pericardial effusion.

IMPRESSION: No significant pericardial effusion seen. Mild global
biventricular systolic dysfunction. Normally-functioning aortic valve
prosthesis. Mild mitral and regurgitation.

Compared with the prior study (images reviewed) of [**2165-2-28**], biventricular
function is less vigorous, however the patient is significantly more
tachycardic today. Regurgitant aortic valve has been replaced with a
prosthesis.

column12:
Pt initially present to [**Location 9296**] on [**2107-12-20**] with productive
   cough.
   LLL pneumonia vs CHF by CXR. Started on levaquin.
   Pt R/I for NSTEMI. Cath showed 99% LM and 99% RCA. EF ~ 35-40%.
   Pt was transferred to [**Hospital1 1**] on [**2107-12-22**] for CABG work up
   Pt to the OR on [**12-26**] for off pump cabg x 3 lima to lad, svg to plv
   with
 to ramus,
   Difficult intubation due to neck is immobile.
   Pt extubated [**2107-12-26**] ~ 1830
   Coronary artery bypass graft (CABG)
   Assessment:
   Alert and orientated x3. MAE and able to follow commands. Pt remains
   NSR, no ectopy noted. HR in the 60
s. SBP ~ 120-100
s/30-50
s. Pt with
   + pp by doppler. Epicardial wires do not capture (A and V wires do not
   capture).  CT draining moderate amount of thin serousanginuous fluid,
   no airleak. LS clear with dim bases bil. Pt on 4 L NC, o2 sats 95-98%.
   Pt with + bs. Foley draining clear yellow urine. UO adequate. Pt on [**Hospital1 **]
   lasix -> diuresing well. Glucose last evening was 137.  Pt Afebrile
   overnight. WBC 19 this am (WBC trending down). Pt c/o back pain
   decline pain medication. NA 132 this am (same as yesterday)
   Action:
          Pt using IS
          Pt repositioned and back rub given
          Vitals monitored
          Meds given as ordered
          Elevated glucoses treated with ss reg insulin per CVICU
   protocol
   Response:
   Pt hemodynamically stable overnight. Diuresing well.
   Plan:
   Pulm toilet, pain control, advance diet and activity as tolerated, ?
   [**Hospital Ward Name 408**] 6 today
